summary: This is a character reference letter written to Judge Alison J. Nathan in support of Ghislaine Maxwell's bail application, dated November 21, 2020. The author, who identifies as a long-time friend, attests to Maxwell's character, integrity, and lack of danger to children, and offers to provide financial surety for her bail.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the bail application and character reference. The author describes her as a close friend of many years, a trustee of her charity, and asserts she poses no danger to children and is not a flight risk.

connections.description: Close friends since meeting in 2002 through a mutual friend. They socialized regularly, including at her 50th birthday, and Lyons served as a trustee for Maxwell's charity Terramar.
Indirect connection through family; Lyons's grandfather (Jack) was a close personal friend of Robert Maxwell.
The author states his daughter Mila adores Ghislaine Maxwell and he would have no hesitation allowing Maxwell to look after her.
Lyons is the parent of Mila, his nearly 5-year-old daughter.

keyFacts: A friend of Ghislaine Maxwell wrote a character reference for her bail hearing, asserting she poses no danger to children and is not a flight risk.
The author offers to provide financial surety to meet any bail pledge the court may set for Maxwell.
The author states Maxwell has faced 'monstrous allegations in the press' that forced her to worry about her safety.
The author claims a multi-generational family friendship, noting his grandfather was a close friend of Maxwell's father, Robert Maxwell.
The letter is addressed to Judge Alison J. Nathan of the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York.
